alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 25 at 2:13PM CDT until April 26 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO EARLY TUESDAY EVENING... .Gusty southerly winds will develop Tuesday afternoon mainly east of highway 61 from Ogallala to Merriman. Afternoon minimum relative humidity will fall off to around 15 percent. Southerly winds will increase Tuesday, as high pressure moves east of the area. The combination of southerly wind gusts up to 35 mph along with low relative humidity, will lead to critical fire weather conditions Tuesday afternoon and evening across most of western and north central Nebraska. . ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CDT /11 AM MDT/ TO 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ TUESDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR LOCATIONS GENERALLY EAST OF HIGHWAY 61 FROM MERRIMAN TO OGALLALA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from noon CDT /11 AM MDT/ to 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In NEZ209...Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin. In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. In NEZ219...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * Winds...South 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Timing...From noon CDT through 8 PM CDT Tuesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...In the middle 70s. * Impacts...Weather conditions will become favorable for rapid fire growth and erratic fire behavior. Fires have a high probability to quickly become out of control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin
